course_metadata.title: World-Class Entrepreneurship Bootcamp: Problem-Solution Innovation Framework
course_objectives: Master the Problem-Solution Innovation Framework for systematic venture creation
Develop critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
Gain hands-on experience with AI tools for entrepreneurship
Build actionable startup ideas or career development plans
Create a network of entrepreneurial peers and mentors

gamification_overview.point_system: Students earn Innovation Points (IP) for completing activities
gamification_overview.badges: Achievement badges for milestones and skill mastery
gamification_overview.leaderboards: Weekly and overall rankings to foster healthy competition
gamification_overview.final_competition: Pitch competition with prizes and recognition

weekly_modules.title: Foundation & Problem Discovery
learning_objectives: Understand the Problem-Solution Innovation Framework fundamentals
Master problem identification and validation techniques
Learn to use the Problem Statement Canvas
Develop empathic design thinking skills
Analyze successful startup case studies through problem lens

topics: Introduction to PSIF and entrepreneurial mindset (30 min)
The Problem Statement Canvas deep dive (45 min)
Case Study: Warby Parker - Identifying the eyewear problem (30 min)
Empathic Design Cycle methodology (35 min)

materials: Warby Parker founding story and problem analysis

activities.name: Problem Hunting Exercise
activities.description: Students identify 10 problems in their daily lives using structured observation

activities.name: Problem Statement Canvas Workshop
activities.description: Create detailed problem statements for top 3 identified problems

activities: Peer feedback on Problem Statement Canvases (30 min)

ai_tool_integration.purpose: Visual problem mapping and canvas creation

gamification_elements.team_challenge: Global Problem Mapping - teams identify problems across different cultures
gamification_elements.leaderboard_criteria: Quality and quantity of problems identified

summative: Week 1 reflection essay on problem-solution mindset (25 points)

weekly_deliverables: Reflection essay on entrepreneurial problem-solving mindset

weekly_modules.title: Ideation & Solution Design
learning_objectives: Master creative ideation techniques and brainstorming methods
Learn to evaluate and prioritize solution concepts
Understand adaptive vs. innovative solution approaches
Develop rapid prototyping skills
Apply AI tools for creative solution generation

topics: Creative problem-solving methodologies (45 min)
Adaptive vs. Innovative solutions framework (30 min)
Case Study: Notion - Reimagining productivity tools (45 min)
Rapid prototyping techniques (30 min)

materials: Notion's product evolution and innovation story

activities.name: Solution Brainstorming Marathon
activities.description: Generate 50+ solution ideas for selected problems using various techniques

activities.name: Rapid Prototype Creation
activities.description: Build low-fidelity prototypes for top 3 solution concepts

ai_tool_integration.purpose: Visual concept generation and mood boarding

gamification_elements.team_challenge: Solution Remix - teams build on each other's ideas

formative: Idea generation quantity and quality (40 points)
summative: Solution evaluation matrix and rationale (20 points)

case_studies.focus: Reimagining productivity through innovative solution design

weekly_deliverables: Solution evaluation matrix with top concept selection

weekly_modules.title: Market Validation & Business Model
learning_objectives: Master customer discovery and validation techniques
Learn to design and test value propositions
Understand business model frameworks and revenue streams
Develop market sizing and competitive analysis skills
Apply AI tools for market research and analysis

topics: Customer discovery methodology and interview techniques (45 min)
Value Proposition Canvas and Business Model Canvas (45 min)
Case Study: Chobani - Market validation and positioning (30 min)
Competitive analysis and market sizing (30 min)

materials: Chobani's market entry and validation strategy

activities.name: Customer Discovery Interviews
activities.description: Conduct 10+ customer interviews to validate problem-solution fit

activities.name: Business Model Canvas Creation
activities.description: Design comprehensive business model for validated solution

activities: Business model peer review and feedback (30 min)

gamification_elements.team_challenge: Market Validation Race - teams compete on interview quality and insights
gamification_elements.leaderboard_criteria: Customer interview quality and business model viability

formative: Customer interview quality and insights (70 points)
summative: Market validation summary and pivot recommendations (20 points)

case_studies.focus: Market validation and positioning in competitive food industry
case_studies.analysis_framework: Customer discovery and business model validation

weekly_deliverables: Market validation summary with pivot recommendations

weekly_modules.title: Implementation & MVP Development
learning_objectives: Learn MVP development principles and lean methodology
Master project management and execution planning
Understand legal, financial, and operational basics
Develop team building and leadership skills
Apply AI tools for project management and development

topics: MVP development and lean methodology (45 min)
Project management for startups (30 min)
Case Study: Zocdoc - Healthcare MVP and scaling (45 min)
Legal, financial, and operational foundations (30 min)

materials: Eric Ries' Lean Startup MVP principles
Startup legal and financial basics guide
Zocdoc's MVP development and iteration story
Team building and leadership in startups

activities.name: MVP Development Sprint
activities.description: Build functional MVP using no-code/low-code tools

activities.name: Go-to-Market Strategy Design
activities.description: Create comprehensive launch and marketing plan

activities: MVP testing and feedback sessions (30 min)

gamification_elements.team_challenge: 48-Hour MVP Challenge - teams race to build and launch
gamification_elements.leaderboard_criteria: MVP functionality and go-to-market strategy quality

formative: MVP functionality and user experience (80 points)
summative: Implementation reflection and lessons learned (20 points)

case_studies.focus: Healthcare MVP development and iterative improvement
case_studies.analysis_framework: Lean startup methodology and MVP validation

weekly_modules.title: Growth & Social Impact
learning_objectives: Learn growth hacking and scaling strategies
Understand metrics, analytics, and performance measurement
Explore social entrepreneurship and impact measurement
Develop fundraising and investment readiness skills
Master data analysis and AI-powered insights

topics: Growth hacking and scaling strategies (45 min)
Metrics, KPIs, and startup analytics (30 min)
Case Study: TOMS - Social impact and sustainable business models (45 min)
Fundraising basics and investor readiness (30 min)

materials: Growth hacking methodology and case studies
TOMS Shoes social impact model analysis

activities.name: Growth Strategy Development
activities.description: Design comprehensive growth plan with metrics and experiments

activities.name: Impact Measurement Framework
activities.description: Create social and business impact measurement system

ai_tool_integration.purpose: Product analytics and user behavior tracking

gamification_elements.team_challenge: Social Impact Innovation - design solutions for global challenges
gamification_elements.leaderboard_criteria: Growth strategy viability and social impact potential

formative: Growth strategy quality and feasibility (70 points)
summative: Growth and impact analysis report (20 points)

case_studies.focus: Social impact business models and sustainable growth
case_studies.analysis_framework: Triple bottom line and impact measurement

weekly_modules.title: Pitch & Future Planning
weekly_modules.theme: Present - Communicating Vision and Next Steps
learning_objectives: Master pitch development and presentation skills
Learn to create compelling investor and stakeholder presentations
Develop networking and relationship building strategies
Create actionable post-course development plans
Build entrepreneurial community and support networks

topics: Pitch deck development and storytelling (45 min)
Presentation skills and public speaking (30 min)
Networking and relationship building strategies (15 min)

materials: Pitch deck best practices and examples
Public speaking and presentation skills guide

activities.name: Final Pitch Competition
activities.description: Present to panel of judges and peers in competition format

activities: Pitch practice sessions and feedback (60 min)
Networking and relationship building workshop (30 min)

ai_tool_integration.training: Automated slide design and content generation

gamification_elements.team_challenge: Final Pitch Competition with prizes and recognition
gamification_elements.leaderboard_criteria: Pitch quality, presentation skills, and peer voting

formative: Pitch deck quality and design (60 points)
Presentation delivery and Q&A handling (70 points)
summative: Course reflection and future planning document (20 points)

case_studies.focus: Synthesis of lessons learned and application to student ventures

weekly_deliverables: Course reflection and future planning document

formative_assessments.description: Weekly activities, prototypes, and peer collaborations

summative_assessments.description: Reflection essays, analysis reports, and strategic documents

innovation_points.bonus_opportunities: Extra points for exceptional creativity, helping peers, and going beyond requirements

leaderboards.weekly_leaders: Top 3 students each week based on points and peer ratings

rewards_and_recognition.pitch_competition_prizes: Cash prizes, mentorship opportunities, and startup resources
rewards_and_recognition.networking_opportunities: Access to exclusive entrepreneur events and communities

training_approach.hands_on_learning: Students use tools in real project contexts
training_approach.prompt_engineering: Training on effective AI communication and prompt design
training_approach.ethical_ai_use: Guidelines for responsible AI usage in business contexts
training_approach.tool_integration: Combining multiple AI tools for comprehensive solutions

ai_literacy_outcomes: Proficiency in prompt engineering for business applications
Understanding of AI capabilities and limitations
Ability to integrate AI tools into entrepreneurial workflows
Knowledge of AI ethics and responsible usage

community_building.online_forums: Discussion boards for each week's topics
community_building.alumni_network: Connection to course graduates and ongoing support

resource_library.template_collection: Business model canvases, pitch deck templates, etc.
resource_library.tool_tutorials: Step-by-step guides for all AI tools

startup_track.incubator_partnerships: Connections to startup incubators and accelerators
startup_track.funding_opportunities: Introduction to angel investors and VCs

corporate_innovation_track.intrapreneurship_roles: Corporate innovation and new venture development

academic_advancement.teaching_assistant_roles: Opportunities to support future course iterations

student_outcomes: 90% of students complete with actionable startup idea or career plan
80% report increased confidence in entrepreneurial abilities
70% pursue entrepreneurial activities within 6 months post-course
learning_effectiveness: Pre/post assessments show 40% improvement in entrepreneurial knowledge
Portfolio quality meets or exceeds industry standards
Peer collaboration ratings average 4.0/5.0 or higher
long_term_impact: 25% of students launch ventures within 12 months
50% report career advancement or pivot within 18 months
Alumni network engagement rate of 60% or higher
